description: Smallest m such that (2n-1)2^m+1 is prime, or -1 if no such value exists.
comments: There exist odd integers 2k-1 such that (2k-1)2^n+1 is always composite.The smallest known example is 78557. Therefore a(39279) = -1.For the corresponding primes see A057025(n-1), n >= 1, where a 0 will show up if a(n) = -1. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 07 2013.
references: Ribenboim, P. The New Book of Prime Number Records. New York: Springer-Verlag, pp. 357-359, 1996.

mathematica: max = 10000 (* this maximum value of m is sufficient up to n = 1000 *); a[n_] := For[m = 1, m <= max, m++, If[PrimeQ[(2n - 1)*2^m + 1], Return[m]]] /. Null -> -1; a[1] = 0; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 08 2012 *)
